page.title: 10EDUCATION POEM HAIKU
page.content:
{THE TOAD} by Emma-Jane Jinks Toad is creased and wrinkled, It looks like a rumpled log. Its eyes shine out in the gloomy dark, An animal of dejection and dread.
Maybe squalling, hopping, ambling, Catching a fly. The gloomy toad is slow to be sly, Sitting in his slimy world, Sitting, watching, waiting.
{HAIKU }by Gregory Plumb On the quiet beach You can see tall ships afloat On far horizons.
{HAIKU} by Anna Cooke Where barnacles graze In deep pastures of the sea Pearls lay in oysters.
